content: ['My wife and I have enjoyed a couple of afternoon teas at the Hilton on Park Lane (plus at other establishments) and once again we had a Buyagift voucher. ', 'Our “sparkling cocktails” which I can only describe as pink grapefruit was not quite what we were expecting. My wife had a pot of tea which wasn’t very hot and I had a coffee. Our three-tier tower of sandwiches and mini cakes arrived soon after. The four quarters of sandwich with various fillings were very small and barely made up one decent sandwich and some of the bread was a little on the dry side. The cakes too were a little uninspiring although the warm scones with jam and clotted cream were good.', 'At no time were we asked if everything was ok but I did ask the waiter for another coffee. content: ["I wasn't overly concerned when I saw quite a few bad reviews as I prefer to judge for myself. The restaurant was pretty empty at the time and we were given the option of a bottle of red or white wine and a choice of either meat, fish or veggie. We opted for the meat which consisted of steak, chicken, potatoes and vegetables. It took about 20 minutes to arrive but was served very hot and I found the meal very tasty. There was more than enough for the 2 of us. We paid £29 instead of £75. At £29 I think this was very reasonable but wouldn't want to pay the full £75. Our experience was very good and I would recommend to others if this wowcher is still available. No service charge was added but we tipped the waiter a fiver anyway. content: ['We had a table booked for 9, took the waiter ages to come and take our order - we ordered from the set menu, the drinks arrived fairly quickly but no food whatsoever was received until nearly half ten (and when food did arrive, the starter was probably the smallest starter I’ve ever had in a restaurant, I’ve been served bigger amuse-bouches for free elsewhere) The mains didn’t arrive until ten to eleven and the chicken breast was like a bog-standard Hunters Chicken that you can find on most pubs menu (and a pub cook would probably pay more care and attention to make it look more appealing than what arrived at our table) Dessert finally arrived at quarter past eleven, a chocolate fondant that was ok but wouldn’t win any awards. The waiter continually kept on about how busy they were on a Monday night, but I would have said there were only 20 or so other people in the restaurant at the same time as us: the couple one side ordered steaks, but they must have waited the best part of an hour for the side vegetables to arrive, and the lady of the couple said her steak was seriously over cooked (although their steaks must have been stone cold by the time the vegetables arrived), and the couple the other side had plates with their leftovers piled up for a good two hours or so before anyone bothered to clear their table. We were offered free coffees as an apology for the time it took to get our food, alas they were nondescript cups of semi-warm, milky water so we left sharpish at this point. It was about twenty to twelve when we finally left - hard to imagine how it could take anyone so long to serve up what was essentially not a lot of food.']

We had contemplated getting additional sides but the board had greens, broccoli, mac and cheese, a steak cooked as we had requested, roasted chicken breasts, roasted vegetables, 'ju', horseradish, Yorkshire puddings and even a couple of onion rings so definitely enough for us both. We also ordered a cheese board which is enough for two and were able to swap the bottle of wine to a large glass and a tea and non-alcoholic drink. I'm not sure I'd pay the full price (£75) unless they get something we didn't but we felt very good value on the voucher and only paid a service charge on the additional items."]
title: More than Expected

content: ["We did a London Trip with our son. Hilton Hotel was perfect for trips to downtown. Staff and breakfast were perfect. Our waiter Constantin Cenusa was one of the best we've ever had.", 'Wonderfull days in a wonderfull Hotel!']

content: ["We attended on a quiet Friday for afternoon tea. To begin with they couldn't find our reservation. We were seated quickly then forgotten about. Other customers were being seated and given drinks.", "After 30 minutes of enduring thirst we managed to flag someone down to ask for a drinks menu. After all, what's an afternoon tea without tea?! The food arrived shortly afterwards which tasted quite stale and shop bought. A glass of cheap Prosecco in the form of an apology from the manager, was not good enough.", "I overheard the the extremely unprofessional staff complaining that they were overbooked and wouldn't be able accommodate all the bookings if they turned up on time. I have no experience in the hospitality industry but surely it would have made sense to get us in, fed and quickly out? Instead we were ignored for over half an hour without any acknowledgement from staff and left without anything to drink or eat. To summarise: unprofessional management, poor food and terrible service."]

content: ['Booked afternoon tea for my wife’s birthday. Monday afternoon so restaurant was expectedly quiet, fine by me. Food was ok, standard set-up, cakes a bit dry. Good choice of tea.', 'Considering it was quiet and they had a lot of staff present it was not nice to see 3 tables around us that hadn’t been cleared when we first got there, 30 minutes before they were done.', 'We also waited a long time to get the food.', 'They did however redeem themselves somewhat by laying on a ‘happy birthday’ plate with fruit and chocolate cake, many thanks for that!', 'During the meal, we would have loved it if a member of staff would have asked if everything was ok, would have really appreciated another pot of tea with those dry cakes!!', 'In summary, we shopped around and paid £20 for afternoon tea for two, what we got was decent value for money but the service needs to improve a bit. 7/10']
title: Afternoon tea

content: ["Visited on a Sunday with a booking for 1pm using a Buy a Gift voucher. We were seated quickly & a glass of prosecco with strawberry purée was brought up straight away. The restaurant wasn't busy and diners were spread out rather than being put in one area which was nice as didn't feel cramped. The cream tea selection was good with four different sandwiches, a fruit scone & a selection of cakes. Neither myself or my daughter like tea or coffee but we were happily offered alternatives at no extra cost. Service was good & friendly & we were asked more than once if everything was ok. Overall a lovely, relaxed cream tea"]
title: Lovely sparkling afternoon tea

content: ['My friend and I went here as a gift for my 30th on a buyagift deal that she kindly got for me. We had both been to a few really great afternoon tea places before, being a Hilton we had high expectations for this one. Sadly it was rather disappointing...aesthetically it looked great, and the views were good; however it took almost an hour after we were served our tea for the food to arrive, when it did arrive the sandwiches were quite soggy, rather bland, and the scones tasted a little on the stale side, the tiffin mini dessert was so horrid I had to discreetly spit it into my napkin. If you had never experienced afternoon tea before I’m sure this would have been a nice experience, having been to a few other places (most likely for half the price) this was a huge letdown. I was just very pleased to be in great company!', 'I would not recommend afternoon tea at the Hilton.']

My advice is Keep it simple) and because of the wowcher deal, they do charge 4,5£ for an extra plate which is not bad, ", 'The place was nice and quiet for a Saturday afternoon', 'Children happy, parents relaxed :)', 'Thank you Beatriz']
title: Afternoon tea with family and a wowcher discount

content: ['We visited on Monday 9 April 2017 for afternoon tea, having been bought a gift voucher from buy a gift.', 'On arrival, there were only two members of staff for the restaurant- the restaurant front of house (and assuming supervisor given the different uniform) and a waitress.', "We approached the restaurant desk, and the waitress saw us, but stood staring for 5-10 mins before then asking if we'd like to sit down.", "We didn't have to wait long for our food, but the service was terrible. The supervisor who brought the food over said the waitress would be over to take our tea order, but she wasn't. We had to flag her down, and when politely asking if we could order our teas, the reception we were given was that we were asking for blood. I don't know about you, but i thought one of the key elements of afternoon TEA is tea after all!", 'The food was average- nothing special, standard cakes. The scones were lovely and had been warmed through which was a nice touch, but the cakes (brownie and fruitcake) were dry and tasteless.', "I wasn't expecting Michelin star, but was disappointed in the lack of service. I'd approached the waitress to ask where the toilet was, and was greeted with a 'what'. That's fine if you didn't hear me, but basic manners, particularly in hospitality can go a long way. Even after repeating myself, the response was cold and rude- an abrupt 'down the stairs' and walked off.", "Given other reviews i'd read about the service, after our own experience, i'd highly suggest further training on waiting staff on basic manners- or better still, hire staff that actually want to be there.", 'The service the restaurant provides brings down the Hilton name.', 'We will not be returning again.']
title: Food average, waitress very poor service and rude

content: ["Had dinner three nights in a row. The menu is simple and to the point. The service is excellent even though at times it seems like Rita is the only one on duty but she was superb; very pleasant, excellent attitude and super efficient even with a full house. Had the Rib Eye steak the first night and it was so good I didn't want it to get finished. Thought of having the same thing the next day but opted for the grilled salmon which gave me the same feeling as the Rib Eye; I wished it didn't get finished! On my 3rd night I had the corn fed chicken breast which was ok though not as filling as the grills which is what I'd recommend. ", 'The menu is basically in two sections: grills with separate sides or mains inclusive of sides. The grills are really well done though a little pricier coz you have to order separate sides. Prices range between £17-20 for the mains including sides and between £17-26 for the grills excluding the side dishes which average around £4 each. Gets very busy on Friday and Saturday nights so important to make a prior reservation.']
title: Amazing food, excellent service!

content: ["I went her for lunch with a couple of colleagues. We ordered our food from the barman, who came to our table without a pen or paper, so we should have known he might get one of the orders wrong, but he successfully managed to get all 3 wrong!!! Might be an idea to invest in a pen and paper instead of trying to be too clever. My steak when it arrived was disgusting. I could tell it had been cooked straight from frozen and was tough and chewy, which would indicate it had probably been in the freezer for a few months. The salmon arrived and was black it was so overcooked and was extremely dry. Even when the manageress came over to try and rectify the situation, she got our order wrong!!! As I was leaving the manageress did tr and make amends by inviting me back for a complimentary meal and giving me her business card. The fact I have declined to eat there for free should tell everyone all they need t know about the restaurant at Hilton Docklands. It's a real shame as Cinnamon used to be quite good and I would eat there a couple of times a week, but the quality of food and standard of service are dreadful. Without a doubt, the food quality is no better than 2 star, regardless of what star the hotel is. content: ['Poor service and even poorer afternoon tea. content: ['We had a lovely food at this restaurant and staff had no issue making some amends to my order which was sweet. I would go back again']
title: lovely food and good service

content: ['Nice setting and attentive staff. The seafood on a board for 2 to share. It was well presented and plenty to share between us. We loved the food and will definitely recommend it!']
title: Had a nice meal there!

content: ['Bought a Wowcher for my partner and myself for his "birthday month", this offer was for a platter (meat, seafood or vegetarian) and a bottle of wine. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a lovely hostess, we were then seated and our drinks order taken. She came back with the selection of which to order, we opted for the meat platter, the offer itself is very generous and we were not disappointed when the meat feast was put in front of us. It had a variety of meats along with roast spuds, carrots, Yorkshire puds and greens, the highlight for me (other than the meat) was a surprising tub of mac n cheese, now, my partner hates cheese, so I was in my element! Lovely atmosphere, pleasant staff and a wonderful dinner.']
title: Wowcher Wednesday

content: ['Staff were polite and friendly, however service was slow. The sandwiches were literally 2 fingers and hardly any feeling in them. The sandwiches were appalling, but the cakes and scones were nice. The bottomless prosecco saved the day, otherwise it would have been a very disappointing and waste of an afternoon.']
title: Afternoon Tea with Prosecco

content: ["I have had a really bad experience with this hotel. I rang up in November to book my afternoon tea voucher which took me a week to get through to them. Every time I rang, I was put through to the restaurant where no one picked up the phone and reception couldn't help me. After that week of trying to get through, I left my name and number for someone to get back to me which they didn't. After trying to ring again the following week, I eventually got through and explained that I had a voucher that expires in December, but if I booked the voucher before it expired, could I still come as they didn't have any availability before the expiry date. They said it was fine as long as I bring the voucher with me. My afternoon tea voucher was booked in for the beginning of January. I had an email from buymeagift.com to say the voucher had expired and when I explained to them that the hotel had said it was still ok to come a few weeks after the expiry date, they said it would be up to the hotel and nothing to do with them. I then tried to ring the hotel back all last week to confirm this with the booking and spoke to a couple of people on reception who then kept putting me through to the restaurant where it was just ringing out again. I rang every day for a week, very angry that no one else could help me and said if someone can please get back to me as soon as possible as it is urgent. Yet again no one got back to me and I have now had to miss out on my booking/voucher.", 'Having been an operation manager in a few hotels myself, I have to say how shocked and disappointed I am and how bad the communication is at the Hilton. I have now had to lose my voucher and very upset as this was a birthday present for me. ', 'I am looking forward to a reply to why this has happened. ', 'My email address is dani_hunt@hotmail.com ', 'Many thanks ', 'Daniela hunt Cortes']
title: Extremely disappointed!!!

content: ["We went there during a quite Tuesday night, so there were just a few tables. We had a great service and an amazing food. Calamari was a lovely start with sweet and sour sauce. Salmon and my sirloin steak for the main course were cooked perfectly as I expected and salmon tasted fresh and full of flavour. As we were having set menu I could not fit a desert and my girlfriend had a fruit plate with which you just can't go wrong with. On the other hand coffees were pretty average for the place, but the food, atmosphere and service toped it up! Really felt that food was cooked by a passionate chef! Happy to come back! "]
title: Mr

content: ['great food, friendly staff - thank you........... I have faith back. from nibbles to a good cool glass of wine. Fab.']
title: drink and food geat - some hotels can get it right

content: ["A friend and I had a Wowcher Voucher. She didn't bring it with her - she said that wasn't specified. I had emailed to book, with the details, didn't get a response so rang. I don't recall being told to bring the Wowcher details either.", 'Anyway, we were not going to be served until she had gone online to get the details, which was slightly problematic as the wifi in the restaurant is not great. [I would have just paid again, so would my mate, if all else had failed. I don\'t think we looked like paupers but we did feel a bit "off."]. ', "So, voucher number supplied, we carried on. I had parsnip soup, followed by chicken. My pal had mushrooms on soda bread followed by Beef Bourguignon. This was all excellent. The soup had very subtle flavours, the chicken was well cooked, but not overcooked. My friend's beef was so tender it was almost flaking. ", "We both went for the exotic fruit platter for dessert - we were both feeling a bit full by now. There was a huge variety of fruit - melon, pineapple, dragon fruit, passion fruit, strawberries, and more. With a champagne sorbet. What's not to like? ", "However, the service was really not up to snuff. Forget about the first bit, when we didn't have the Wowcher details. The restaurant and bar are all managed by the same person, but this is not a huge bar, although the restaurant itself does have a fair few tables. However, when we arrived there were only a couple of other tables full, and at most, six, with a couple with two people, one with four and a couple with six and eight. So, this was not a busy restaurant (no doubt why they did the Wowcher deal). ", "We ordered our main course and starters but had to wait quite a while for the wine. We asked for water and were give an glass each. I wouldn't have minded that, but other tables were given a jug. (By the way, we were not the only Wowchers there that night, so it wasn't that.). I must say that the manager/maitre d', when he served us, was very attentive, but the service was inconsistent. ", "There were a couple of people working in the restaurant, a couple in the bar (which was not mega busy either) and people kept disappearing. A customer at another table broke a glass, but it was badly cleared up and it took me quite a while to get someone to deal - quite apart from the fact that there were children in the restaurant, this is a very basic H & S issue. It was always a priority when I worked in bars and restaurants, but food was coming up for another table, so H & S went by the wayside. As I have said, it wasn't busy and I really don't think broken glass should be left and this is something that should be checked properly. As it was, he left it behind a sign for quite some time - it still wasn't cleared away when we left. I would never had allowed this when I ran a pub.", "Everyone was pleasant, but I just don't think they were organised enough. Would I go again? The food was good, but service is part of the whole thing for me, and there are so many other places to go in London, maybe not. That's a real shame for the chef."]
title: Food Good, Service Needs Improvement

content: ['Had burger and chips £16 followed by a cheeseboard £6, quite basic though. Fine for what it was - I suppose it was London prices. Strange being stuck on a table in the corner with my work colleague - unless they thought it was an intimate dinner for two Northern men.']
title: Good food and attentive service

content: ['My husband and I had an afternoon tea, which was a gift from friends so we have no idea what the cost would have been. We thought the staff were very attentive and did their best to ensure we enjoyed this. The food was nice but I did think there should have been more savoury items, either a few more sandwiches or maybe a savoury scone. The fruit scones were lovely with plenty of cream and jam. Two pots of tea and three glasses of prosecco went down very nicely! Mini cakes ok but a bit uninspiring and the lounge was very basic, but overall a very pleasant couple of hours. Thanks to Andre for his good service.']
title: Afternoon tea

content: ['Where to start?', "Booked to have afternoon tea and arrived a little early to find they didn't have my booking! The waiter still managed to fit us in even thought they were fully booked. The team who looked after us were very polite and helpful. ", 'My one complaint would be that we had one sandwich (cut in to four) each and five cakes and a scone. Just a bit to much sweet stuff for my taste. The champagne cocktail was nice if a little small. ', 'A nice afternoon but think I will try somewhere else next time.']
title: Afternoon tea

content: ["Extremely poor service. There wasn't a single, notable issue but everything added up to result in a less than enjoyable evening. As we were shown to our table we were advised a pre-ordered bottle would be brought over. We waited quite a while for this and, during that time, were asked by 2 different waiters if we'd like to order drinks. ", "I ordered calamari with roasted peppers for starter.....the calamari came with radishes; not a pepper in sight. The soup starter was slopped over the bowl as it was served and did not come with bread (interesting the word 'soup' is actually omitted from the menu!). ", "We waited a long time between courses. At one point we were brought main courses meant for another table. I asked if someone could check how much longer we would have to wait for our mains. But the staff are rather surly, the service somewhat shambolic and the atmosphere flat']
title: Spend your money elsewhere

The staff there was kinda confused but they showed us to a table. It was only us on the whole floor, which was a bit weird. The food and drinks was amazing, but we never got any tea.']
title: Afternoon tea without tea

content: ['We visited the Hilton Canary Wharf for Afternoon Tea using a Wowcher deal on a midweek day. Meet and greet was ponderous and initial service slow despite the fact that the restaurant was not that busy. The staff were nice and very courteous , and service did improve. The actual afternoon tea was tasty and well presented , but the portion sizes were small, the cake selection limited and only one smallish scone each - hence the average rating. Have had better teas than this.']
title: Afternoon Tea

content: ["Booking made via phone, on arrival they didn't have our reservation.", 'Taken to Executive Lounge. Served by a receptionist not waitress. Tables not set for afternoon tea. No atmosphere, TV on wall, business men working on laptop. Chunky cheap coffee cups and plates. Tea bags not tea leaves, hot water taken from machine, not piping hot. Extremely disappointed as was a gift.']
title: Awful Afternoon Tea Poor Service Dreadful Food Poor Service.

', "The food in general was ok. Fruit Tart was lovely, Scone could have been better and it seems under baked. Sandwich was good but the chocolate cake was a bit heavy. title: Afternoon Tea

content: ["I'm sure this hotel is really lovely to stay, but we had an afternoon tea, and it was bad, the service was terrible , we had to ask for tea and coffee, the sandwiches were nice but equivalent to 4 slices of bread, when we asked for more they said we had to pay extra, I have been to different places for afternoon tea before, and,I Must say this was the worst I have had, the staff weren't that friendly , we arrived early and the sat us in the main resturant and when we said we were supposed to be on the 14 floor the manager said it was fully booked, my husband complained and they took us upstairs, surprise nobody in the resturant, completely discussing ."]
title: Afternoon champagne tea

content: ['This is really tricky... Food quality and presentation is 4.5 starts but the service is -1 star... The main host named Leo, was the most unpleasant and rude person I have ever met. title: Service horrible but the food was good

title: Awful

content: ['Poor afternoon tea. Only one scone each few sandwiches and the cakes were miniscule. A ripoff we asked for more sandwiches and we and another table were told we had to pay extra!! We refused to pay extra.']
title: Afternoon tea rip off

content: ["We went for afternoon tea on the 14th floor, hotel seemed quite nice, but tea very disappointing. Very small sandwiches and tiny pieces of cake - and only one scone each!! So all in all a very disappointing experience."]
title: Disappointing afternoon tea

content: ['Normally, when I read reviews, I choose to ignore the negative comments as I understand everyone has different tastebuds. This is the first time I wish I actually believed everyone who said it was terrible.', "From the moment we walked in, it wasn't great. The waitress served us a mocktail, we thought 'great start!' And the food arrived promptly. After waiting for atleast 20 minutes for our hot drinks, I finally went up to request tea (afternoon tea without tea is just bizarre). The waitress came around, no apologies, she merely asked what we wanted. Usually, they hand you a list of tea options, but she just asked what we wanted, so I just chose the English Breakfast tea as I didn't know what was on offer. The food was mediocre. Sandwiches tasted like the Supermarket ones, the festive treats were far from treats. The only thing that was tasty were the fresh scones. Seeing as there wasn't much food, we asked for another plate of sandwiches and scones, only to be told that would cost an extra £5 per plate! I've been to so many Afternoon Tea places and I've never been charged extra. This was quite shocking. All in all, very disappointing. Service was rubbish (the place was empty as well) and the food was worse. Avoid this place!"]
title: Disappointment

content: ['Firstly I would like to say I have stayed at a number of Hilton Hotels and have always found the Staff and Service very good.', 'However the Hilton Canary Wharf should be ashamed at how poor their Service is!!!', 'We arrived today for a special Afternoon Tea (Birthday) and it\'s hard to describe how bad the Service was. This treat?? Was booked months ago, on arrival at the cinnamon restaurant we were shown to our seats. There were 10 other people in the Restaurant at the time. With this we decided to leave.', "This afternoon Tea had been booked weeks in advance so it wasn't a last minute arrangement why were there inadequate staff? title: Afternoon Tea Shocking - Hilton you should be ashamed!!!

We also had a cocktail offer as a treat for my birthday from my friend', 'The only let down was, that my friend did say it was her daughters birthday when she spoke with the Hilton on the telephone, and it would have being a nice gesture to offer a Special Dessert treat for her', ' ( as do many restaurants now a days)', ' Overall we did have a lovely time and would recommend to our friends']
title: Pleasant meal, lovely relaxed surroundings

content: ["I was doing a lot of travelling and sat down to order and couldn't remember my room number. The staff made sure I was well looked after and sorted out my problem without once making me feel uncomfortable. The risotto was great with a super salad. Definitely will go back."]
title: Great food, excellent service

title: Superb

title: Cream Tea

Would I recommend or go there again No. Go to Park Lane 100 times better, maybe a little bit more expensive but not much more.']
title: Afternoon Tea with chanpagne

content: ["I purchased a Wowcher for Afternoon Tea for 2 at Cinnamon Restaurant and Bar at Hilton London Canary Wharf. I was not surprised.", "Upon arrival we were served our champagne cocktail and later the Afternoon Tea stand arrived. The waitress put it on the table and walked off, didn't explain what was what and in fact didn't ask whether any of us had allergies when actually both of us have allergies. The stand wasn't attractive and just looked dull in presentation. The sandwiches were ok, but the scones were almost hard and disappointing. When the tea and coffee arrived I had to ask for milk, then when ordering a second coffee, the waitress forgot our order. title: Mediocre AFternoon Tea

title: Champagne cocktail afternoon tea

title: Don't have afternoon tea there

title: A Belated Birthday meal.

The were dressed in track suit bottoms etc. It just felt that this experience was not at all special and we were just plonked in the middle of all the other guests. ", 'I was very disappointed in the whole experience as I am sure my daughter paid quite a lot of money for the afternoon tea. I would not recommend this to anyone else.']

', 'Only down point was that we had to go down to the basement where the carpark was to go the the bathrooms.']
title: Lovely and quiet

title: Afternoon Tea

title: Disappointing

content: ['The restaurant was mostly empty but the staff were friendly and efficient. Food very nice and beautifully presented. Bit lacking in atmosphere as quite empty. Very corporate. Central location, so good for visiting the City. Nicely decorated for Christmas.']
title: Afternoon Tea

title: Afternoon Tea was nothing special

content: ["Having had a good visit to this restaurant a few months back, we decided to return for dinner. They don't seem to be able to cope with even a few tables of diners. Our cocktails took a long time to arrive. Four out of five drinks were made and left on the bar for 10 minutes before the fifth one was made and brought over. The starters were OK. Things started going wrong with the mains - fish platter was missing the squid, the chips were cold and the burger was missing the bacon and onions. The only redeeming fact was that they didn't charge us for the wine and the dessert. I'm sorry, but won't be returning."]
title: Most unimpressive

content: ['My sister and I came to the bar for some drinks for her birthday after seeing an offer on the FEVER app which allowed you to have 4 cocktails for £19, which was quite cheap considering their cocktails are usually about £9 each. ', "First of all, we were greeted very rudely by the man behind the bar, or rather, not greeted at all when we entered. He told us that we needed to have a booking, despite the app clearly saying just to show up and present the voucher. He made us feel very unwelcome. Keep in mind, at the time we went we were the only people there. It's not as if there weren't any tables to offer. We did finally get seated, and ordered our first two cocktails. He repeated the order back to me, but still managed to give us an incorrect cocktail. Another bartender made them, and she said that's what the other guy had told her. This lady was a lot nicer and apologetic, and improved the otherwise bad atmosphere. We also ordered two things from the snack menu- hand cut chips with truffle mayonnaise and calamari. These were horrendous. The mayonnaise clearly wasn't fresh. It looked like it was stored open in a fridge, as a layer had formed on top of it, and condensation appeared as well. The chips were cooked unevenly,some brown and some under cooked and not crispy on the outside at all. The calamari looked like scraps and was incredibly greasy. It was barely coated, and severely overcooked. I have never seen these cuts of squid served as calamari in any restaurant before. ", "As for the cocktails, they were not anything special, and I definitely wouldn't have paid the full price for them. ", "I would not suggest to go here if you plan on using a voucher code or app because it's just not worth the experience. ", 'Having been to the Hilton Sky bar and enjoyed both the cocktails and the food, it was a shame to have such an inconsistent experience at another Hilton bar.']
title: Disappointing

content: ['The food and service was great. It is a bit more pricey than the average restaurant but that is to be expected in a hotel.']
title: Good food

content: ["The only reason that I didn't giver 4* due to the glass of plonk that came with our afternoon tea, it tasted very weak. Every thing else was really good food and service"]
title: Nice afternoon tea

content: ['Absolutely gorgeous! The service was great, very pleasant and friendly staff! The food was amazing, although the scones were a bit dry/over cooked! :( But apart form that, gorgeous! Thank you to the staff who were great :)']
title: Amazing Afternoon Tea

content: ["Ok to eat if you are staying at Hilton, but not worth coming here if you aren't staying at the Hilton. Average food. Average service. First question they ask - are you staying with us ... Is that supposed to make a difference?? Why not just seat people and give them a menu? They got the appetizer and main course together - huh?? Not worth the trouble"]
title: Ok to eat if you are staying at Hilton, but not worth coming here if you aren't staying at the Hilton

content: ['My boyfriend booked here for a pre-valentines meal and I took it upon myself to check it out before (OCD behaviour). Anyway after reading the reviews I was adamant I did not want to go here. My boyfriend being him said nope we are going - end of. ', 'I am beyond glad we went! The service, the food, the company, the ambience, everything was just fabulous. Only one thing though, I hate sitting on the front line (by the windows) where people can see you. However it was like 8pm so foot traffic was practically non-existent. ', 'The waiter assisted me in choosing a red wine and was ever so helpful in suggestions and explaining the background of each label followed by a sample. When chosen they ensured that our glasses were topped up.', "In between courses they kept the table topped up with bread. The starters; I had the salmon which was absolutely lush (and I am not a great fan of cold fish) and he had the ham hock (didn't look appealing to me but tried it minus the eggs and it actually was quite nice.", "The mains I had the halloumi cheese with salsa and onion rings- nice big chunks of halloumi. Slightly overdone but I didn't mind as the saltiness of halloumi can be a bit overwhelming. The onions rings were perfect and nicely sized. Very filling overall. He had the surf and turf. Nicely sized prawns although they were not entirely fresh but you can only tell if you are a prawn fan like me. He had chips on the side. This definitely was not your typical type of chips. You could tell they were hand cut as they resembled wedges more than chips. ", 'The overall ambience was nice. It was soooo toasty. Normally being sat by the window always brings a draught. But it was very cosy. As it was an evening the restaurant was full but not packed at all. You still had the traffic of the hotel in the bar area which is just before the restaurant part. It was quiet enough to have a conversation and loud enough to mask your conversation also. ', "Didn't have dessert as I was very full on the 2 courses. But the options weren't nothing enticing anyway. ", "Least dislike was the lady once forget something we asked for and my fella had to go over to reception to get her attention. Liked our waiter the most..he made the whole experience pleasurable. Can't remember his name but he was a French, tall black man."]
title: Glad I didn't listen to the bad reviews

content: ['I had an high tea for two.', 'It was said we should have a champagne but we had just a strawberry prosecco.', "The savouries were just ok the sweets were all good but maybe not enough. Portions were really small compared to other locations. Coffee wasn't really good.", 'Staff just asked once if we wanted a refill. Btw really friendly and kind.']
title: High tea experience. Just ok.

content: ['This is a subsequent review. We gave constructive feedback to Armand at the hotel and received a response offering a complimentary tea due to our initial less than praiseworthy experience. We declined this kind offer due to logistics but thanked him anyway. To our surprise we receive a further email from a lady called Jan from Hilton worldwide in response to our constructive feedback. She was to send a fifty dollar credit card for our use. We were not looking for financial gain but we responded thanking. Her for her gesture of goodwill.Two to three weeks later we still had not received any card so we emailed just to say that we had not received anything from the Hilton. There may have been a problem but we were not expecting the next Hilton email from a guy called Tony at HIlton worldwide. He emailed to say that he had no proof of any experience that ww had engaged in previously and had declined the credit card which was to be forwarded to our personal address. His assessment was that it was a misunderstanding. It is embarrassing to receive such reply and to put into question out credibility and honesty even though the paper trail of all the encounters was also forwarded to this gentlemen on the same occasion. ', 'Our afternoon tea experience was bought as ta Christmas present from our son in law who is a Hilton diamond member.', "We have replied to Tony requesting that he now let's us have details of the Chief executive officer of the Hilton worldwide in order that we may vindicate ourselves from the extraordinary predicament and embarrassment we find ourselves.", 'The whole matter is like having a sledgehammer to crack a walnut and none of this is our own making.', 'As far as we are concerned this is not to gain financially, rest assured.', 'However,we need to make future guests aware of our experience in order that they do not have to deal with the nightmare scenario which has enveloped our life.', 'We now fight for the principle of being treated as valuable customers']
title: Afternoon tea in January

title: Average

content: ["I don't normally feel compelled to write reviews, but did this time after having dinner at Cinnamon. We were the only people in the restaurant at 9:00pm on a Thursday night...maybe that should have told us something. ", 'First, I asked the waiter about the Ox Cheek entree, and his response was, "I would stay away from that". No problem, I ordered the surf and turf instead...steak and prawns. ', 'The steak was ok, not horrible but maybe average. Part of it was very chewy. The prawns were a whole different story. Typically when I think of prawns, I think of something bigger than a shrimp. I know prawns can be small as well, and these definitely were...very small. And they were so over cooked and rock hard that I could barely cut through one of them with a steak knife. ', 'The waiter did agree that they looked "bad" and asked the chef to make more. More were brought out, again very small, but at least properly cooked this time. Only downfall is that a few of them still had the veins clearly showing. ', "Beyond that my wife's entree was small and her side of mashed potatoes were very bland and lacked any flavor. ", 'To top it all off, the price was a little high especially considering the lack of quality of the food. 2 entrees, 2 sides, a glass of wine, and a glass of beer came out to 76 pounds with tip. I have had much better meals elsewhere in London for half of that cost. ', 'We are staying at this Hilton for 3 nights, but do not plan on eating here again. ']
title: Overpriced and average food at best

content: ['A friend and I had surf & turf with cut chips. You hardly had to cut the steak. Wine and bread both really good. The service was very good too.']
title: Amazing

content: ["Used a groupon offer today for High Tea. I have had at least one dozen high Teas in London and this rates fairly low down. We wandered around the hotel for some time before anybody acknowledged us. The waitress was polite enough.I requested tea and was offered no choice whatsoever. Usually that is the highlight of High Tea when you are allowed to pick from dozens of different teas. When our tea was brought up she said we could have refills whenever we wanted but we never saw her again,even when we left our table. I could not believe my eyes when I saw the string and tag hanging out of the teapot.!!! This is supposed to be The Hilton Hotel. A top class hotel! and a teabag!!!?? The resulting tea was like dishwater but we could not see the waitress to even complain about it.Some of the sandwiches were stale. the one scone we had each was the size of a 50p piece. We were given enough cream to cover at least half dozen that size. The cakes were ok. So very disappointed as this was a gift to my guest. We finished our meal and got up and left and there wasn't a single member of staff around. Not impressed at all."]
title: Tea Bag used

content: ["We bought afternoon tea vouchers off groupon. This was my first time going for an afternoon tea and was so disappointed. The atmosphere was not relaxed/cosy. I really liked the Victoria sponge cake and this other thing don't know what it's called but had fruits and jelly in a crust. W another negative thing is they only had time slots between 1-3 which is very odd because that's lunchtime! I have tea around 5. So it was very awkward we couldn't decide if we should have an early lunch. But then we would be too full. When we saw the snacks we were thinking we're gonna wipe it clean but in actual fact it was very filling and we couldn't finish it off had so much left over. Overall I think afternoon tea should be cosier more homey and definitely not at 1pm!!after this o went to another afternoon tea in Scunthorpe called giles absolutely loves it it was very vintage deco everything suited. Was such a lovely tea room. "]
title: Disappointed

Helpful lady when complained and was compensated us but a shame as it was a special birthday for my nan. Very disappointing X ']
title: Bad service

content: ["Seven of us came here using Groupon Vouchers and were joined by another three who were going to choose and pay of the menu.This was to be a treat for my mums 90th birthday which l told the receptionist when l booked the table but when we arrived we were shown to a large table that had benches around it, not at all suitable for my old mum and had to get them to remove a bench and replace with a suitable chair. Our order took over an hour to arrive and just came in dribs and drabs with the fries and pepper sauces turning up as people were finishing there small steaks. Mine and mums seabass was very tasty but again my fries and her mash potato turned up as we were nearly finishing our meal.I know restaurants like to cook vegetables al'denta but the portion of vegetables my mum were given were almost raw. l was served the wrong salad and by the time the correct salad arrived l had finished my meal. I was bitterly disappointed as l wanted it to be special for her. I felt that as we were using vouchers the staff were not really interested in us, although very polite they were just not bothered.We were not offered a desert menu or asked if we wanted more drinks .The rest of the family who had ordered off the main menu were equally disappointed and were told that they would not be charged. But as we had paid upfront with Groupon were offered nothing. To make matters worse we were the only ones in the restaurant that day and when it came to us leaving the staff had all disappeared without a word of apology. NEVER AGAIN... ", ' A PLACE TO AVOID']
title: 90th Birthday Treat For Mum 13th December 2015

content: ["This Review is very late as I was not yet writing reviews on trip advisor. My friends and I had purchased group on vouchers in 2012 for the cinnamon restaurant at Hilton Canary Wharf and the vouchers expired in January 2013. This meant that over the festive season of 2012 we were enjoying brunches on a Sunday morning with family and friends and even got to celebrate my son's and dad's birthday together as a family gathering. The deal was £19 for two adults but you could add children at £6 each at the restaurant. ", 'Where do I start? Well the ambiance was fantabulous to say the least, very comfortable furnishings which although classy enough was still very child friendly. The staff could not be more accommodating which is what one would expect from somewhere like the Hilton. They were all so attentive and child friendly. Our party was filled with lots of children and we never once felt the we needed to apologise for this.', 'The food? Well certainly the star of the show. The variety of choices for breakfast was amazing but not just variety and quantity but also quality and well prepared. Then there was the choice of meal from the lunch menu which was like a fusion Asian theme and it did not disappoint!', "If it was not for the groupon deal I probably would not have been aware of it and without the deal it would have been far more pricey but based on the quality of food, services and ambience I would gladly pay full price to have brunch here once per month. Unfortunately this morning I rang up to book a table for two adults two kids fro brunch and was told that they no longer do brunches, only breakfast. They don't even do lunches anymore. I was so disappointed to say the least. I guess perhaps they were unable to sustain brunches as that side of Canary wharf is not very busy on weekends and they could not keep doing groupon deals. Shame as I've not been able to find anywhere else in South East to do a brunch as good.", "By the way I've put October 2013 only because they won't allow the date to go back as far as 2012 and I feel it would be an injustice if I didn't write this review even though they no longer do brunches. Thunk we might try their breakfast though and will let you know how that goes."]
title: BEST BRUNCH EVER!!!

content: ["We purchased a travel zoo voucher to use at the Cinnamon restaurant at the HIlton in Canary Wharf for £19 to include a cocktail and brunch for two. We managed to book a table for a Saturday just before Christmas and wasn't really expecting too much considering the price. We needn't have worried.", 'We were treated to some very good food. The brunch included the choice of two cocktails and included tea, coffee or fruit juices. You were able to choose from a wide variety of hot food with a fresh egg station where you could choose how your eggs or omelette were cooked. All the food here was of a high standard and hot. You were then given the option of choosing one item off the a la carte menu which had sea bass, a sweet potato curry, a chicken dish, roast beef and vegetables, scallops and many more.', 'I chose the beef with yorkshire pudding and vegetables which arrived on a hotplate sizzling and cooked to perfection. It was a large piece of sirloin which was delicious, My husband chose the sea bass and vegetables which he said was lovely too.', 'We both felt that this deal was brilliant value for money and given the chance would return for another helping!']

content: ['Work. Sleep three hours. Get up with aching arms and legs and fly. Travel all the way across London and arrive at hotel. ', 'Well, of course we fell straight asleep, and by the time we managed to wake up it was getting a bit late to go anywhere else than here. Never again, even if I have to stay awake 24 hours plus.', "So, where to start? The service, I guess. Unfortunately our waiter didn't have much understanding of English and had to be helped out constantly by his colleague, who was only marginally better. They gave the impression of pretty serious incompetence, even in a completely empty restaurant. Of course, there was no atmosphere as a result of this - the sterile decor didn't help.", "On to the food - my bream dish had three elements on the plate, and these tasted spicy, spicy and, er, spicy. The fish, coated with a layer of courgette slices, was actually cooked for the correct length of time, but was spiced into oblivion and didn't seem too fresh. The crab, leek and pea ragu underneath it was absolutely vile, again spiced into oblivion but I could still manage to taste that the crab seemed tinned. The third element was harissa, which was decent enough but I'd had enough spice by now. In case you're wondering, I do actually like spicy food - even extremely hot food when called for - but not when the spices obscure all the other flavours on the plate. Another thing I would have liked here was a bit of crunch, there was nothing in this dish with any real bite resistance.", 'My companion had lamb knuckle. This was marginally better but rather boring, particularly the limp-tasting sauce. Too much gristle remained in the lamb, and a piece of string had somehow made its way onto the plate. ', 'We shared a chocolate & chilli fondant for dessert, this was better than either of the main courses but again uninspiring, the chilli taste was too subtle (must have all been used up in the bream) and was just dry heat without a trace of the fruitiness I was hoping for. ', 'None of this was particularly cheap - I believe our mains were in the £18 price range, which is quite excessive when the quality is sub-Cafe Rouge. I have guesstimated a price of £35-40 for 3 courses exc drinks and service. This makes it a place to avoid with extreme prejudice.']
title: Downright bad, 3/10
